job_description:
Automation Engineer
On-site Montreal, Quebec
Full-time

About the role

My client is hiring an Instrument & Electrical Engineer to contribute to the design, development, and testing of electrical equipment, components, or systems. Applies mathematical and engineering principles and methods to electrical designs. In this role, you will work closely with cross-functional engineering teams to test and troubleshoot photocatalysts and photocatalytic reactors. In doing so, this person will directly contribute towards the development of the companies revolutionary new technology and drive sustainability in the chemical manufacturing industry.

Key Duties and Responsibilities
Project Support - Work within a project team, teamwork, schedule adherence, execution, start-up, commissioning, owner interaction, qualifications.
Provide support in designated area/field. Depending on assignment, this may be DCS, PLC, SCADA, BAS, Validation, Manufacturing and Utilities Areas.
Communication - Will be responsible for providing excellent communications (verbal/written) within area of responsibility.
Use/demonstrate problem solving skills to best support and meet the needs within area of responsibility.
Promotes a collaborative and cooperative environment which embraces the ability to work effectively within teams.
Capable of adhering to Good Manufacturing Practices (GxP) - Compliance, Change Control, Quality Oversight, Validation.
After hours support may be required. May prepare, review, and/or approve validation and/or engineering documents. Review and analyze data, prepare and review reports (example: Quality Metrics, etc...).
Additional duties as assigned/required.

Qualifications required
B. Sc in Engineering, Automation, Computer, Industrial, Manufacturing or related program and 3 years of direct experience in automation engineering and/or validation, or M.Sc in Engineering, Automation, Computer, Industrial, Manufacturing or related program and 1 year of direct experience in automation engineering and/or validation. An equivalent combination of education and experience may be accepted.
System Technical Skills: Emerson DeltaV DCS - Design, Configuration, Troubleshooting, Maintenance, Administration; Allen Bradley PLC/HMI - Design, Configuration, Troubleshooting, Maintenance, Administration; Wonderware SCADA - Design, Configuration, Troubleshooting, Maintenance, Administration; Schneider BAS - Design, Configuration, Troubleshooting, Maintenance, Administration; Optel Serialization/Vision Systems - Design, Configuration, Troubleshooting, Maintenance, Administration; Instrumentation - Design, Specifying, Troubleshooting; System Documentation - Drawings, FRS, SDD, URS, SOPs; Qualification / Validation - DeltaV, PLC's, Optel Vision systems, Serialization, Packaging Equipment; Wincc7.4 SCADA Design, Configuration, Troubleshooting, Maintenance, Administration; Siemens Automation Platform ,PLC/HMI/ Servo Drive - Design, Configuration, Troubleshooting; iFIX SCADA,Configuration, Troubleshooting, Maintenance, Administration; PLC/PC Based Electrical Control Panel Design; Kuka and Staubli Robots Design, Configuration, Troubleshooting, Maintenance, Administration; and Industrial Network, IO link , Smart IO.
Process Technical Skills: GxP Understanding - Compliance, Change Control, Quality Oversight, Validation; Utilities - WFI, CSG, Steam, HVAC, Chillers, Air, Chemical Tank Farm, Water, WWTP, Alcohol/Ethanol; Manufacturing - Fractionation, Purification, CIP, UF, Process, Chromatography; Sterile Filling - Filling, Autoclave, Sterilization Tunnels, Freeze Drying, Pasteurizer, Glass Washer; Packaging - Serialization, Packaging Equipment, Optics; Continual Improvement - Optimize and implement process improvements; Operational support - Provide support for process issues; and, Troubleshooting issues with operational areas and systems. Experience in managing, leading and coaching employees, projects, teams is preferable.
Good communication skills (written and verbal).
Proficiency with Microsoft office including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Bilingual in both French and English preferred.

If you're interested and want to discuss this further and find out more about the company, role and compensation package, then apply here or email e.childs@hamlynwilliams.com
